result.execSummary:
The defendant Zackery Ryan Tohm was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Child Pornography, a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.12(1m).
  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: $290.60 fine/cost to be paid to the Department of Corrections while on Extended Supervision.
Must provide DNA sample and pay the $300.00 DNA surcharge to the Department of Corrections while on Extended Supervision.

No contact with children under the age of 18 unless allowed by probation/parole. 
Allow phone contact with brother or half siblings while incarcerated as well as letters. 
No electronic devices unless required by school or work or as set forth by the Department of Corrections.
Must follow Compas Evaluation recommendations. Mandatory sexual offender reporting for life.
$500.00/image totaling $1000.00 to be paid to the Department of Corrections while on Extended Supervision.

miscConds.notes: $290.60 fine/cost to be paid to Probation while on Probation.
Must provide DNA sample and pay the $300.00 DNA surcharge to Probation while on Probation.
May not possess or use firearms or body armor.

Follow rules of Compas Evaluation. Follow rules of Probation.
Can not vote until civil rights restored.
Can not hold public office.
If not U.S. Citizen may face deportation.

CASES: 12CF485 & 14CF150.  Defendant Zackery Ryan Tohm not in court.  Daniel P. Steffen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  CW-clerk 11:52 am.  Items stipulated for return are ordered.  Ms Seeley to provide list & blank thumb drive-State to draft order.  12:13 pm adj.
Hearing on January 28, 2015 at 11:30 am.
To the Judge from Jennifer Seeley - regarding return of property and time for hearing.  Back on judge's table for review.
Sentencing - November 17, 2014.

CASES: 12CF485 & 14CF150. Defendant Zackery Ryan Tohm in court with attorney Brian Thomas Smestad.  Defendant Zackery Ryan Tohm in custody.  Daniel P. Steffen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  CW-clerk 1:13 pm.  1:41 pm - recess.  2:05 back on the record.  

12CF485
Count 16-w/h, probation up to 5 yrs, consecutive to count 1 in 14CF150 but concurrent w/ probation in count 9.  Follow rules of supervision/COMPAS.  Mandatory lifetime SO reporting.  SO rules apply as well.  No contact w/ children under age of 18 unless allowed by probation/parole.  Probation is to monitor any contact with brother or half siblings.  $290.60 fine/costs.  Pay thru probation.  If not paid at end of supervision-reduced to civil judgment.  4 days credit.  No firearms, cannot hold elected office, cannot vote until civil rights restored. If not US citizen face deportation or loss of other civil rights.  No body armor.  

14CF150
Count 1-10 yrs, 3 yr IC, 7 yr ES.  Credit for 206 days.  Not elig for CIP or SA pgm.  Mandatory SO reporting for life.  Order $500/image for total of $1000. $290.60 fine/costs.  DNA surcharge-$300.  Follow COMPAS.  No contact w/ children under age of 18 unless allowed by probation/parole.  Allow phone contact w/ brother  or half siblings while incarcerated as well as letters.  Follow SO conditions as set forth.  No electronic devices unless by required by work/school or as set forth by probation.
Count 9-w/h sentence, probation up to 3 yrs, consecutive to count 1.  $290.60 fine/costs.  DNA surcharge-$300.  Pay thru probation/ES.  Follow rules of probation, follow COMPAS evaluation.  
No firearms, cannot hold elected office, cannot vote until civil rights restored. If not US citizen face deportation or loss of other civil rights.  No body armor.  
Remanded to Dodge Correctional for intake.
2:42 pm adj.
Sentencing hearing on November 17, 2014 at 01:00 pm.

CASES: 12CF485 & 14CF150.  Defendant Zackery Ryan Tohm in court with attorney Brian Thomas Smestad. Defendant Zackery Ryan Tohm in court, in custody.  Daniel P. Steffen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   CW-clerk 3:00 pm.  Steffen-motion to void the plea previoulsy taken & re-enter plea in 12CF485.  
12CF485-court vacates finding of judgment, withdraws plea as to count 1.  Also withdrawing Read-ins & dismissal.  Entire complaint is reopened.  Smestad-ask for modification of bond.  CT modifies bond.  Exh 1-O&R.
Count 16-Def-guilty.  CT-accept plea, adj guilty.  All other counts DRI for sentencing/restitution.  Convicted felon-no firearms, cannot vote until civil rights restored, cannot hold elected office, no body armor, if not US citizen face deportation or lose other citizenship rights.  BOND AMENDED EFFECTIVE AT 9 AM ON 11/7/14.  Must return to Polk County Jail no later than 7 pm on 11/7/14 at which time the bond converts to cash bond.  Bond cont as amended.  3:35 pm adj.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for November 17, 2014 at 01:00 pm.
Sentencing hearing on November 6, 2014 at 02:00 pm.
